intro: Sweetia brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked sweetia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Sweetia brachystachya is often found in open habitats such as dunes and coastal scrub.
